Monday, December 13, 2021

5:30 PM

Mayor Sumbul Siddiqui

Arrived

5:40 PM

Dec 13, 2021

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. Transmitting Communication from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appropriation
of $64,230 from Free Cash to the General Fund Elections Department Salary and Wages account
($24,700), to the Other Ordinary Maintenance account ($38,930) and to the Travel and Training
account ($600), to cover the additional costs associated with the Special State Primary and Special
State Election for the 1st Suffolk and Middlesex Senate District to fill the vacancy formerly held by
State Senator Joseph A. Boncore.
CMA 2021 #274
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

2. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appointment
of Kimberly Massenburg, PH.D., Executive Director of the Margaret Fuller Neighborhood House as a
member of the Community Benefits Advisory Committee for a term of three years, effective
December 13, 2021, as recommended by the Cambridge Nonprofit Coalition.
CMA 2021 #275
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

3. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to the appointment
of Police Department Deputy Superintendent Frederick Cabral as a member of the Human Services
Commission for a term of three years, effective December 13, 2021.
CMA 2021 #276
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

4. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting Report
Item Number 21-87, regarding a report on senior scam prevention efforts.
CMA 2021 #277
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 2

Dec 13, 2021

5. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to new
appointments and reappointments of the following persons as members of the Cambridge Immigrant
Rights & Citizenship for a term of three years, effective December 13, 2021 - New Appointments:
Eva Gottschalk, Abhishek Raman and Joe Manok. Reappointments: Karim El Razzaz and Jennifer
Sparks.
CMA 2021 #278
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

6. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to new
appointments and reappointments of the following persons as a member of the Human Rights
Commission for a term of three years, effective December 13, 2021 - New Appointments: Stephen
Curran and Judith Laguerre and Reappointments: Yasmin Padamsee Forbes.
CMA 2021 #279
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 3

Dec 13, 2021

II. CALENDAR

CHARTER RIGHT
1. That the City Clerk is requested to forward the Home Rule Petition establishing a Net Zero
emissions requirement for building construction in Cambridge in accordance with its Net Zero
Action Plan, adopted in 2015, to the entire state legislative delegation for immediate adoption.
POR 2021 #264
Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Nolan, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

ON THE TABLE
2. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting
Report Item Number 21-13, regarding next steps on implementation of Universal Pre-K.
PLACED ON THE TABLE IN COUNCIL MAY 17, 2021
CMA 2021 #123
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 12/20/2021 5:30 PM

3. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting
Report Item Number 21-41, regarding a report on closing Mass Ave from Prospect Street to
Sidney Street on Friday and Saturday evenings.
CHARTER RIGHT EXERCISED BY COUNCILLOR MCGOVERN
IN COUNCIL JUNE 28, 2021
PLACED ON THE TABLE IN COUNCIL AUGUST 2, 2021
CMA 2021 #176
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 12/20/2021 5:30 PM

4. A communication transmitted from Louis A. DePasquale, City Manager, relative to Awaiting
Report Item Number 21-56, regarding improvements to Jerry's Pond and along Rindge Avenue.
PLACED ON THE TABLE BY MAYOR SIDDIQUI IN COUNCIL SEPTEMBER 13, 2021
CMA 2021 #193
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 4

Next: 12/20/2021 5:30 PM

Dec 13, 2021

5. That the attached Home Petition titled “PETITION FOR AN ACT AUTHORIZING THE CITY
OF CAMBRIDGE TO ENACT AN ORDINANCE TO LIMIT AND MONITOR CAMPAIGN
DONATIONS IN LOCAL ELECTIONS BY INDIVIDUALS SEEKING FINANCIAL
REWARD FROM THE CITY OF CAMBRIDGE” be forwarded to the General Court for
adoption.
PLACED ON THE TABLE IN COUNCIL DECEMBER 6, 2021
POR 2021 #248
Councillor Carlone
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 12/20/2021 5:30 PM

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
6. That the City Council adopt a municipal ordinance to reduce or limit campaign donations from
donors seeking to enter into a contract, seeking approval for a special permit or up-zoning,
seeking to acquire real estate from the city, or seeking financial assistance from the city;
Ordinance #2020-27.
PLACED ON THE TABLE IN COUNCIL NOVEMBER 8, 2021
PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL DECEMBER 6, 2021
TO ORDAINED ON OR AFTER DECEMBER 20, 2021
POR 2020 #240
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor
Zondervan
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 5

Next: 12/20/2021 5:30 PM

Dec 13, 2021

V. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. Fossil Fuel Special Permit Policy Order
POR 2021 #268
Councillor Nolan, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

2. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to work with the Election Commission to send
voter notification cards for both primary and general special elections
POR 2021 #269
Vice Mayor Mallon, Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

3. COVID19 Expert Advisory Panel
POR 2021 #270
Mayor Siddiqui, Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

4. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to work with the Department of Human Service
Programs, the Cambridge Police Department, and other relevant departments to create a publicly
accessible, comprehensive list of violence prevention programs that exist in the city and to place this
list on the City’s website
POR 2021 #271
Vice Mayor Mallon, Councillor Simmons, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 14

Dec 13, 2021

5. Reaffirming Commitment to the Goal of 100% Renewable by 2035
POR 2021 #272
Councillor Zondervan, Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan

6. That the City Manager be and hereby is requested to work with the Director of Traffic, Parking, and
Transportation and Divco West regarding the spending plan and possible reallocation for the
anticipated GLX refunds, and to report to the City Council on the use of GLX Project Participation
Agreement funding in a timely manner.
POR 2021 #273
Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor Mallon, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Zondervan,
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Simmons, Councillor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor
Toomey
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Carlone, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Vice Mayor
Mallon, Councillor McGovern, Mayor Siddiqui, Councillor Simmons, Councillor
Toomey, Councillor Zondervan


PAGE 15

Dec 13, 2021
